# Installation

> Get started with contributing to the Open Doctrine Repository.

The Doctrine site is built using **Nuxt Docs Template**.

- [Live demo](https://docs-template.nuxt.dev/)
- [Documentation](https://ui.nuxt.com/docs/getting-started/installation)

The following instructions will help you run your own Doctrine locally.

## Quick Start

First, clone the Doctrine repo:

<code-group>

```bash [https]
git clone https://github.com/thefreemavens/doctrine.git
```

```bash [ssh]
git clone git@github.com:thefreemavens/doctrine.git
```

```bash [GitHub CLI]
gh repo clone thefreemavens/doctrine
```

</code-group>

## Setup

Make sure to install the dependencies:

```bash
npm install
```

## Development Server

Start the development server on `http://localhost:3000`:

```bash
npm dev
```

## Production

Build the application for production:

```bash
npm build
```

Locally preview production build:

```bash
npm preview
```
